title: Leicester in secret talks with Roy Hodgson over replacing sacked boss Claudio Ranieri
text:
Leicester in secret talks with Roy Hodgson over replacing sacked boss Claudio Ranieri ROY HODGSON has held talks with Leicester about replacing Claudio Ranieri, according to reports. PUBLISHED: 18:55, Tue, Feb 28, 2017 | UPDATED: 19:29, Tue, Feb 28, 2017 GETTY Leicester are interested in making Roy Hodgson their new manager 
The MailOnline claim the former England boss held secret talks with Leicester representatives last Friday in south-west London following Claudio Ranieri's controversial sacking. 
It is claimed the 69-year-old is admired as a long-term successor to Ranieri by Leicester owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha. 
Hodgson is said to be interested in a return to management following his stint with England and Srivaddhanaprabha apparently sees him as the man to turn Leicester's disastrous season around. GETTY Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha views Roy Hodgson as a long term successor to Claudio Ranieri 
However, Hodgson is not entirely convinced by the idea of taking over at the King Power Stadium. 
But the Leicester owner is keen to get him on board and is likely to hold further talks in the coming days and weeks with Hodgson in a bid to convince him to take the reins. 
Craig Shakespeare is likely to remain in interim charge after guiding Leicester to an emphatic 3-1 win over Liverpool last night, but he could just be keeping the seat warm for the arrival of Hodgson.
